name: Flask setup
body:
flask setup =========== http://weldan.github.com/flask_setup script to start new flask project to be use with:
  1. os, debian/ubuntu
  2. python 2.5 or later
  3. web server, apache2 with mod_wsgi enabled
it is not required to download this as tarball. you only need makefile. it basically install flask microframework with peewee orm support. visit this url if you need more information: http://flask-peewee.readthedocs.org/en/latest/getting-started.html when executed on first time, it will create these files and directories.
Name Type Purpose
environment directory to put virtual environment, required packages, files and folder
templates directory to put html template files
static directory to put static files such as javascript,images, and css files. those files can be put in their respective directory, for example, script.js in static/javascripts and style.css in static/styles
database directory to put sqlite database file, if needed
schema directory to put sql files
wsgi directory to put wsgi file
app.py python script file application skeleton file
requirements.txt text file required applications for your app, to be use later

usage

  1. create new directory for new project. 
    mkdir /var/www/projectname
  2. execute this in project directory 
    wget -nc https://raw.github.com/weldan/flask_setup/master/makefile -O ./makefile && make install && . environment/bin/activate && python app.py
  3. open http://127.0.0.1:5000 through web browser and see this text: 'Hrllo' , to ensure installation process is a success
  4. you can remove all these files with `make clean`
  5. you can reinstall with `make refresh`
